It's tough. She's a wanderer. She pops up on the grid here and there but... I mean, the last time she paid an electric bill in Europe was '94. No taxes. No steady employer. She's got three arrests. Speaker: marie
Dialogue: -- we'll explain it --

Speaker: marie
Dialogue: -- there's two of us -- we'll tell them -- we'll just --

Speaker: bourne
Dialogue: -- forget it --

Speaker: marie
Dialogue: -- we'll tell them what happened --

Speaker: bourne
Dialogue: I don't know what happened!  I don't know who he is! I don't know what he wants! I don't even know who I am! The only thing I know is that if I stay here, I'm never gonna find out!

Speaker: bourne
Dialogue: Come with me.  I can protect you.

Speaker: wombosi
Dialogue: -- No! -- I say, no! -- they go this far -- out a body in the grave -- another body! -- no! -- this isn't over -- these people are not finished -- nothing will make them finish until they have Wombosi! -- the real Wombosi -- until I'm the one in the box! --

Speaker: wombosi
Dialogue: -- what are you doing? --

Speaker: wombosi
Dialogue: -- there is no box for Wombosi! -- they don't have a box that can hold me! -- I know these people -- I know they never sleep! -- I know they never stop! -- they never stop until the knife is at their throat! --

Speaker: wombosi
Dialogue: -- and it won't just be me! -- they don't just want Wombosi now! -- they want my babies -- they want my children! -- and I say no! --  -- everything changes here now! -- everyone is a soldier here now! -- this is a fortress now! Are we clear with this?

Speaker: deauvage
Dialogue: Yes, sir. All clear.

Speaker: wombosi
Dialogue: This man is out there. Kane is out there. And they pretend he's dead. That means he's coming back.

Speaker: conklin
Dialogue: Is that a medical term?

Speaker: abbott
Dialogue: Let's assume that's true.

Speaker: conklin
Dialogue: This unit has an unblemished record of success.

Speaker: conklin
Dialogue: That was two hours -- two hours to get a second opinion -- and nothing changes. He's loose. He's out of control. It's very clear what needs to happen.  I have work to do.

Speaker: abbott
Dialogue: What if he is working for someone else? What if he turned?

Speaker: conklin
Dialogue: Turn? To who? Where does he turn? What does he have to offer? He's got nothing. He's a killer. He's a piece of equipment for crissake. Where's he gonna turn?

Speaker: bourne
Dialogue: No.  I can't live like this. I can't do anything until I know who I am. Believe me, you don't want what I have.

Speaker: marie
Dialogue: You stayed there five times in the past six months. But I didn't have time -- I could only get the bill from the last stay -- you were there for two days. Some room service -- there's half a dozen phone calls here so that's someth--

Speaker: bourne
Dialogue: Who paid the bill?

Speaker: marie
Dialogue: It's a company... MPG Capital.

Speaker: marie
Dialogue: This can't be it.

Speaker: telephone voice
Dialogue: I'm afraid there's no Richard here.

Speaker: bourne
Dialogue: Well, where are you? Where am I calling?

Speaker: telephone voice
Dialogue: This is an answering service, sir. The company's located in Southampton, but --

Speaker: bourne
Dialogue: -- this is a tire dealership, right?

Speaker: telephone voice
Dialogue: No sir, this is a navigational chart registry. I'm afraid you have the wrong number.

Speaker: bourne
Dialogue: Hey, so this is the Marina, right?

Speaker: new voice
Dialogue: Yes, sir. Can I help you?

Speaker: bourne
Dialogue: This is the one in Marseille, right?

Speaker: conklin
Dialogue: -- let's check that Interpol window again --

Speaker: conklin
Dialogue: -- I want that red car -- the girl -- we gotta get lucky here --

Speaker: abbott
Dialogue: No.  We can't risk it.

Speaker: conklin
Dialogue: Our last sighting was forty-eight hours ago. Even if they stayed in the car, the grid is huge.  This is it. He's trained -- conditioned -- they're built to disappear. You give him another day to run and we may never find him.

Speaker: abbott
Dialogue: This doesn't go upstairs.

Speaker: rawlins
Dialogue: Mr. Kane...  Come right in... please... have a seat.

Speaker: bourne
Dialogue: Thanks.

Speaker: rawlins
Dialogue: Well...  I must admit, when my assistant told me you were here I was, really -- I was quite -- I was surprised.

Speaker: bourne
Dialogue: Really.

Speaker: rawlins
Dialogue: We thought you were gone for good.

Speaker: bourne
Dialogue: Did you?

Speaker: rawlins
Dialogue: Well, I mean it's a tough business, isn't it? Cutthroat.

Speaker: rawlins
Dialogue: I'm assuming you're still in the market. It's the same vessel?

Speaker: bourne
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: rawlins
Dialogue: We just picked up a job quite like the one we were bidding for you. Gorgeous boat, hundred-and-seventy- five-foot pleasure cruiser. I think we learned a few things that might allow us to make our proposal for your job, as I said, a bit more competitive.

Speaker: bourne
Dialogue: Okay.

Speaker: rawlins
Dialogue: Was it the break-in?

Speaker: bourne
Dialogue: Excuse me?

Speaker: rawlins
Dialogue: We also thought we hadn't heard from you -- we've had a bit of a publicity nightmare, people have been talking.  Our offices were broken into -- vandalism mostly -- shortly after we last spoke.

Speaker: bourne
Dialogue: I hadn't heard.

Speaker: rawlins
Dialogue: Let me get you a new copy of the proposal.

Speaker: bourne
Dialogue: That'd be great.

Speaker: marie
Dialogue: I found it.  I found Kane. I found the body.

Speaker: bourne
Dialogue: Let's go --  We got to get away from this phone.

Speaker: bourne
Dialogue: Kane. John Michael Kane.

Speaker: bourne
Dialogue: I want to see the body.

Speaker: marie
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: morgue boss
Dialogue: They came last night.  His brother.

Speaker: morgue boss
Dialogue: Who are these people?  Who are you? What's going on here?

Speaker: bourne
Dialogue: Where did this body go?

Speaker: morgue boss
Dialogue: I said, someone came last night --  Look, this isn't a carnival -- people call and they make an appointment and they follow the rules -- everyone signs in and out -- this is a serious place -- serious work -- it's not just to come in whenever you like --

Speaker: bourne
Dialogue: Shit, we didn't sign in.

Speaker: morgue boss
Dialogue: So get the hell out of here.

Speaker: bourne
Dialogue: Fine. But I'd like to sign in. In fact, I insist on it. Where's the book? I gotta sign in --

Speaker: bourne
Dialogue: Is this it? --  -- this is it, right? --

Speaker: morgue boss
Dialogue: -- slow down -- you can't just take the book like that --

Speaker: bourne
Dialogue: -- don't sweat it, I have a pen -- no problem -- just let me find the page --  -- honey, why don't you wait for me outside, okay? --

Speaker: morgue boss
Dialogue: -- we have rules here, this is a very serious place -- I'm the one who decides who gets in here, okay? --

Speaker: bourne
Dialogue: -- what do I? -- I put the name of the person I came to see? --

Speaker: morgue boss
Dialogue: -- this is serious business down here and we cannot have people coming and going --

Speaker: bourne
Dialogue: -- here we go -- I found it --

Speaker: morgue boss
Dialogue: -- what are you? -- what are you doing? -- you crazy fuck -- you ripped the book! -- you stupid fucki--

Speaker: marie
Dialogue: What are you doing? --  -- Jason -- stop -- talk to me...

Speaker: marie
Dialogue: -- I don't know what you're doing and you're scaring me -- what are you looking for? -- what just happened in there? --

Speaker: bourne
Dialogue: Nykwana Wombosi.

Speaker: marie
Dialogue: What is that?

Speaker: bourne
Dialogue: It's a name. Mr. Wombosi owns a thirty million dollar yacht. He's the proud owner of an Alliance Security package.

Speaker: marie
Dialogue: What does that mean?  Jason, please... who is he?

Speaker: bourne
Dialogue: I don't know.

Speaker: marie
Dialogue: So what are we doing?

Speaker: bourne
Dialogue: Go back to the hotel.

Speaker: zorn
Dialogue: They found him. They found Bourne.

Speaker: abbott
Dialogue: Where?

Speaker: zorn
Dialogue: You better come in.

Speaker: deauvage
Dialogue: Jesus fuck, what is this?

Speaker: abbott
Dialogue: Omigod.

Speaker: conklin
Dialogue: -- how long? --

Speaker: abbott
Dialogue: -- he went inside! --

Speaker: conklin
Dialogue: -- if we can get a clean shot --

Speaker: abbott
Dialogue: -- inside the house? --

Speaker: conklin
Dialogue: -- that's what they're trained for -- just a surgical strike.

Speaker: abbott
Dialogue: Forget it.

Speaker: conklin
Dialogue: What do you want to do?

Speaker: abbott
Dialogue: We don't know what we're into!

Speaker: conklin
Dialogue: We're in the shitter, man! Pick your poison. Maybe he's in there to finish the job. Maybe he's working for Wombosi. Maybe they want to go on TV together. Every possibility sucks -- we've got to move!

Speaker: bourne
Dialogue: Is he here?

Speaker: conklin
Dialogue: You don't have the stones for this. You people come down here and wink and whisper and we send these guys out and get it done. And you're clear. And the guys upstairs get what they want. And the whole bunch of you are so stuffed on deniability it's coming out of your ears.  Well, you know what? You're here now. What do you want to do?

Speaker: wombosi
Dialogue: Come in.  Please...

Speaker: wombosi
Dialogue: Did you bring investment advice for me tonight? It was tax shelters, wasn't it? Swiss debenture-swaps.

Speaker: bourne
Dialogue: MPG Capital.

Speaker: wombosi
Dialogue: I think investment advice from a dead man, it's a bad idea.  How does it feel to be dead?

Speaker: bourne
Dialogue: It's a lot more stressful than I thought.

Speaker: wombosi
Dialogue: -- no -- no, let them in! -- let them in.  I think everyone wants to see the dead man.

Speaker: wombosi
Dialogue: What do you do?  -- you put this in my engine room!

Speaker: wombosi
Dialogue: So this is a different kind of meeting.  Maybe now we talk some truth, okay? One dead man to another.

Speaker: wombosi
Dialogue: You see this?  I told you my shot was better!

Speaker: deauvage
Dialogue: He went in the water -- how did he live?

Speaker: wombosi
Dialogue: No, no no...  It's bloody fucking amazing.

Speaker: bourne
Dialogue: Who do you think sent me?

Speaker: wombosi
Dialogue: I know who sent you. I don't know why.  Was the bomb on my boat supposed to go off or not?

Speaker: wombosi
Dialogue: You didn't set the bomb. Why?

Speaker: wombosi
Dialogue: Was this a game or a fuck up?

Speaker: bourne
Dialogue: I don't know.

Speaker: wombosi
Dialogue: Get the kids out!

Speaker: wombosi
Dialogue: And the door.

Speaker: conklin
Dialogue: -- code him again -- punch it in --

Speaker: conklin
Dialogue: -- the paging unit must be damaged --

Speaker: abbott
Dialogue: What are you doing?

Speaker: conklin
Dialogue: I'm going to Paris.

Speaker: abbott
Dialogue: No you're not. You're not going anywhere. I'm shutting this down.

Speaker: conklin
Dialogue: You're not doing shit. You're so scared you can't even think.

Speaker: abbott
Dialogue: You just blew up a house in Paris! This program is over. Call it off.

Speaker: conklin
Dialogue: I can't call it off. He's not responding. Get out of my way.

Speaker: marie
Dialogue: It doesn't matter who you were before. It's who you want to be. That's all that matters.  I say we leave here. We leave this place. We go until we can't go anymore.

Speaker: bourne
Dialogue: You could do that?

Speaker: marie
Dialogue: Yes. That's who I want to be.

Dialogue: I won't ask again.

Dialogue: I work alone. Like you...  ...we always work alone.

Speaker: bourne
Dialogue: What do you mean?

Speaker: professor
Dialogue: Who are you? Rome? Paris?  Treadstone... both of us... I was warned but...

Speaker: bourne
Dialogue: Treadstone?

Speaker: professor
Dialogue: ...which one are you?...

Speaker: bourne
Dialogue: Paris. I live in Paris...

Speaker: professor
Dialogue: ...headaches... you have that... I get such bad headaches...

Speaker: bourne
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: professor
Dialogue: ...it's a problem...

Speaker: bourne
Dialogue: Treadstone.

Speaker: professor
Dialogue: ...or in a car... when it's dark... something with the headlights...  ...pills, right? Treadstone had those pills...

Speaker: bourne
Dialogue: What is Treadstone?

Speaker: professor
Dialogue: ...what did you do?... you must've really fucked up...

Speaker: bourne

Dialogue: ...someone said caffeine -- for a headache... doesn't seem...

Speaker: bourne
Dialogue: What do they want me to do?

Dialogue: ...they won't let you go...

Dialogue: Look at this...  ...least you have a woman....

Speaker: marie
Dialogue: Jason...

Speaker: marie
Dialogue: We've got to go.

Speaker: bourne
Dialogue: Take this.

Speaker: bourne
Dialogue: Take it.

Speaker: marie
Dialogue: And that's it?

Speaker: bourne
Dialogue: If you're lucky.  Take it.

Dialogue: What was I thinking, right?

Speaker: bourne
Dialogue: I can't protect you anymore.

Speaker: marie
Dialogue: What about you?

Speaker: bourne
Dialogue: I'm gonna find the end of this.  I can't protect you.

Speaker: bourne
Dialogue: What did you do to me?

Speaker: conklin
Dialogue: What did I do? What've you done? Do you have any idea? Any conception? What you've destroyed? Do you have any idea how much time and work -- how many people have their lives wrapped up in this?

Speaker: bourne
Dialogue: Are you Treadstone?

Speaker: conklin
Dialogue: Am I Treadstone? Me?  What the hell're you talking about?

Speaker: bourne
Dialogue: What did you do to me?

Speaker: conklin
Dialogue: What did I do? I spent thirty million dollars on you. I spent three years finding you -- four years training you --  What in the name of God have you been doing, Jason?

Speaker: bourne
Dialogue: I don't know.

Speaker: conklin
Dialogue: They're right about you, aren't they? You're fried.  You really don't know what's going on, do you?

Speaker: bourne
Dialogue: I know you've been trying to kill me.

Speaker: conklin
Dialogue: Of course. We had to try. We didn't know what was wrong.  We didn't know you were in trouble.

Speaker: bourne
Dialogue: So now you know.

Speaker: conklin
Dialogue: So it's time to go home.

Speaker: bourne
Dialogue: That's all I get?

Speaker: conklin
Dialogue: We'll make you better. We can put the pieces back. We can do that.

Speaker: bourne
Dialogue: I don't think so.

Speaker: conklin
Dialogue: We have to go home, Jason.

Speaker: bourne
Dialogue: Jason Bourne is dead.

Speaker: conklin
Dialogue: There never was a Jason Bourne.  You have to come with me. It's the only way. We can give it back to you...

Speaker: bourne
Dialogue: Keep it.

Speaker: conklin
Dialogue: Jason...  They can't let you go...

Speaker: bourne
Dialogue: That'll be their second worst mistake.

Dialogue: ...We'd hoped it might build into a good training platform, but quite honestly, for a strictly theoretical exercise, we thought it was far too expensive. The cost-benefit ratio was just too high. It's been all but decommissioned at this point.

Dialogue: All right, what's next?

Speaker: abbott
Dialogue: Okay, this is Blackbriar. Blackbriar is a joint, DOD, communications program that we really feel has good traction to it.

Dialogue: Can I help you?
